oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1954-03-27 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry show from March 27, 1954. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), George Morgan (host, performer), Helen Traubel (performer), Rod Brasfield (performer), the Anita Kerr Singers (performers), Minnie Pearl (performer), Little Jimmy Dickens (performer), Stringbean (performer), and Don Davis (performer). Part 1: http://cmfdigitization.cmf.int:2011/cdm/ref/collection/musicaudio/id/627
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Helen Traubel; Rod Brasfield; George Morgan; Little Jimmy Dickens; Stringbean
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Prince Albert Commercial (Grant Turner, George Morgan) -- Prince Albert jingle -- George Morgan and Helen Traubel introduce Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, Helen Traubel, Rod Brasfield) -- George Morgan and Helen Traubel talk -- It May Be Silly (But Ain't It Fun) (Helen Traubel, George Morgan, Rod Brasfield, Little Jimmy Dickens, Minnie Pearl) -- George Morgan introduces Stringbean -- My Little Georgia Rose (Stringbean) -- Helen Traubel introduces George Morgan -- I Think I'm Going To Cry (George Morgan) -- Closing statement (George Morgan, Helen Traubel) -- Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Announcer closing statement
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Morgan, George, 1925-1975; Traubel, Helen; Brasfield, Rod; Anita Kerr Singers; Minnie Pearl; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Davis, Don, 1928 December 22-
